CSS Zen Garden: 2026 Edition

Welcome to a demonstration of what modern CSS can achieve. This single HTML document transforms dramatically across four distinct themes — each showcasing a radically different visual language while maintaining the exact same semantic structure.

The Power of Design Tokens

Using a three-layer token architecture (primitives → semantic → component), we can achieve CSS Zen Garden-style transformations through pure CSS custom properties. Each theme only redefines what changes — the cascade handles the rest.

The separation of structure from presentation is the foundation of maintainable design systems. With modern CSS, this separation is more powerful than ever.

What Makes This Work

The system leverages several 2024-2026 CSS features:

  • CSS Layers — Cascade control without specificity battles
  • @property — Typed custom properties with animation support
  • oklch() — Perceptually uniform color manipulation
  • light-dark() — Single-line theme mode switching
  • CSS Nesting — Cleaner, more maintainable selectors
  • :has() — Parent-aware styling without JavaScript

Theme Showcase

Use the theme switcher in the top-right corner to experience the transformation. Notice how each theme brings its own personality:

Swiss Minimalist

Clean lines, precise typography, zero-radius corners. Inspired by the International Typographic Style — letting content breathe through negative space and stark contrast.

Organic Nature

Warm earth tones, flowing curves, subtle textures. Bringing the feeling of handcrafted materials and natural forms to digital interfaces.

Brutalist

Raw, honest, unpolished. Harsh shadows, monospace type, exposed structure. The web as construction site — nothing hidden, nothing pretending to be what it isn't.

Neon Cyber

Dark backgrounds, glowing accents, terminal aesthetics. A vision of interfaces from cyberpunk futures — where technology meets neon-lit streets.

Technical Implementation

The theming system uses scoped custom property overrides. Each theme file only contains a single @layer theme block that redefines semantic and component tokens:

[data-theme="swiss"] {
  --color-surface: white;
  --color-primary: oklch(50% 0.25 25);
  --radius-interactive: 0;
  --shadow-card: none;
  /* ... */
}

This approach means themes are additive — they layer on top of the base system rather than replacing it entirely. A theme file can be as small as 50 lines or as detailed as 500 lines depending on how much customization is needed.

Interactive Elements

Buttons, inputs, and other interactive elements automatically inherit theme styling:

Grid Identity System

The layout you see uses semantic HTML elements (header, nav, main, footer) that automatically register their grid areas. Change data-layout on the body to switch between layouts:

  • stack — Mobile-first vertical stack
  • sidebar-left — Navigation on the left (current)
  • sidebar-right — Content sidebar on the right
  • holy-grail — Classic three-column layout
  • app-shell — Persistent nav with horizontal header

No classes needed on the semantic elements — their grid areas are derived from their identity in the DOM.
